thread.title: Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts
thread.title_full: Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts

title: Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts
text: > Entertainment Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts Heaps of corn kernels sit on a mill in the Pontifical Palafoxiano Seminary kitchen, where Sister Florinda Ruiz Carapia, better known as "Hermana Flor," cooks three meals a day for the seminarians, in Puebla, Mexico, Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015. The plain-spoken Mexican nun has become an unlikely television star while trying to save her congregation from mounting debts. The 68-year-old nun is one of five finalists on Mexicoâ€™s version of "Master Chef," a program in which contestants compete for a 1 million peso ($59,000) prize. (AP Photo/Eduardo Verdugo)
